New Records: Glenn Phillips became the first batter to score a century in World Cups while batting in the middle order, joining Brendon McCullum as the only two New Zealanders to hit a T20 World Cup hundred.
Key Match Events: Glenn Phillips came in at 7/2, took on the role of aggressor after Kane Williamson's dismissal, and scored a century in 61 balls with 10 boundaries and 4 sixes.
Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand lost three early wickets, putting pressure on the batters, and Glenn Phillips took over the role of aggressor after Kane Williamson's dismissal.
Post-Match Reflections: Glenn Phillips' century helped New Zealand win the match, and his achievement of scoring a T20 World Cup hundred in the middle order was significant.
